news_header: A tragic school bus fire in Thailand killed 23 students and teachers, highlighting serious road safety issues and prompting calls for stricter vehicle safety regulations.
news_text: Following a deadly school bus fire in Thailand that resulted in the deaths of 23 students and teachers, investigations are underway to determine the cause, with a gas leak being a potential factor. The bus was found to have 11 natural gas canisters despite only having a permit for six, raising public outrage over safety standards. The Thai government plans to inspect all CNG buses to ensure compliance with fire safety regulations. Road safety in Thailand has long been a concern, with high traffic fatality rates, particularly involving motorcycles. Similar road safety challenges are faced by neighboring Southeast Asian countries, prompting calls for improved regulations and the use of technology to enhance road safety.
